description: From Middle English celebritē, from Old French celebrite (compare French célébrité), from Latin celēbritās.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Fame, renown; the state of being famous or talked-about. [from 17th c.]
examples: Synonyms: big name, distinction, fame, eminence, renown

entries.meaning: A person who has a high degree of recognition by the general population for his or her success or accomplishments; a famous person. [from 19th c.]
examples: Synonyms: big name, star, (informal) celeb, (informal) sleb, luminary, notable, media darling
